CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 11, 1967, pg. 16, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Dennis Morgan leaving Saint Richards."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "St. Richard's R. C. Church Scene of Pretty Wedding - Saint Richard's Roman Catholic Church was the scene of one of the fall season's most fashionable weddings recently when attractive Joeva Delphines Jenkins became the bride of Dennis Morgan. The Rev. Donald McIlvane officiated at the ceremony.  The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Dorothy Jenkins, while the groom is the son of Mrs. Gertrude Morgan.  Given in marriage by her uncle, Walter Jenkins, the charming bride was resplendent in a formal gown of silk over taffeta.  It was styled with a bouffant skirt with tiers of chantilly lace encircling the hemline.  The neckline of the gown was enhanced by seeded pearls and iridescent sequins and the chapel train formed a watteau back of tears which was detachable.  She wore a matching pill box with floral trim from which fell a bouffant shoulder-length veil of illusion.  The bride carried a white bible topped with orchids.  Exciting fall colors were selected for the bride's attendents' gowns.  They were floor-length gowns of gold satin with long sleeves and matching detachable lace coat ensembles.  The wore gold Dior bows with matching veils as head-pieces and carried nosegays of white and gold carnations.  Mrs. Deann Jones was matron of honor.  Bridesmaids included Mrs. Ardella Scott, cousin of the groom, Mrs. Pauletta James, Miss Eva Mae Robinson and Mrs. Jo Ann Smith.  Leroy Holloway was best man.  Ushers were Calvin Morgan, brother of the groom; Maurice Turner, Virgil Cox, Donald Jenkins, uncle of the bride, and Levi Hanner.  Kimberly Jenkins, sister of the bride was the adorable flower girl.  Raymond Rhodes, cousin of the groom was ringbearer.  The bride's mother was attractively attired in a two-piece blue silk brocade suit with pink accessories.  The groom's mother was stunning in a two-piece brown and chocolate suit trimmed in mink with matching accessories.  A gala reception honored the newlyweds at the William H. Carney Post.  Good food and live entertainment complete with music by The Crossfires was enjoyed by the more than 200 guests.  The newlyweds have now taken up residence in their newly furnished four room apartment  on Bryn Mawr Rd."
TitMainTitle: Groom Dennis Morgan, and bride Joeva Delphines Jenkins Morgan wearing pill box with veil and lace gown, seated in back of car
